trial_identification.studytitle: Phase I dose-escalation study for CYT997
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Phase I dose-escalation study of CYT997 given as a 24-hour intravenous infusion every three weeks in patients with advanced solid tumours

conditions.healthcondition: Cancer - solid malignancies that are metastatic or unresectable

interventions.interventions: CYT997 administered as a 24 hour intravenous infusion every three weeks

primaryOutcome.outcome: To establish the dose-limiting toxicities of CYT997 given as a 24-hour continuous intravenous infusion
primaryOutcome.timepoint: From data collected during the first cycle.

primaryOutcome.outcome: To establish the maximum tolerated dose of CYT997 given as a 24-hour continuous intravenous infusion
primaryOutcome.timepoint: From data collected during the first cycle.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: (i) To study the pharmacokinetics of CYT997
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: From data collected during the first and second cycles.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: (ii) To characterise the toxicities and tolerability of CYT997
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: From data collected throughout the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: (iii) To define a recommended dose for Phase II studies
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: From data collected during the first cycle.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: (iv) To make a preliminary evaluation of anti-tumour activity
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: From data collected throughout the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: (v) To make a preliminary evaluation of vascular-targetting activity
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: From data collected during the first cycle.
From data collected during the first cycle.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: (i) Patients must have solid malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard curative or palliative anti-neoplastic treatments do not exist or are no longer effective.(ii) Life-expectancy of greater than 3 months(iii) No anti-cancer chemotherapy or hormonal therapy for the preceding 4 weeks(iv) Patients must have adequate organ and marrow function(v) Willing to give informed consent.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: (i) Patients must not have received other investigational agents within the preceding 4 weeks(ii) Patients with known brain metastases are excluded from the trial(iii) As CYT997 may have vascular targetting activity, patients with various cardiovascular risk factors (including MI or stroke within 6 months; unstable angina; symptomatic peripheral artery disease etc) are excluded(iv) Pregnant women and patients with immune deficiency are also excluded.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: CYT997 is an experimental anticancer agent with vascular targetting activity. This Phase I trial aims to determine the safety and tolerability of CYT997 when given as a 24-hour intravenous infusion.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Department of Medical Oncology Royal Brisbane and Women's Hospital
